it.hackcaffebabe.netutil.mail

Class MailerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.hackcaffebabe.netutil.mail.MailerManager

  • public class MailerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that describe the mail primitive ( login and send ) to send a email.
    It's needs a properties file like this that describe the server information:

    #IMPLEMENT THIS KEYS FOR DIFFERENT CONNECTION SETTINGS
    mail.smtp.starttls.enable=true
    mail.smtp.socketFactory.class=javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory
    #THE FOLLOW PROPERTIES ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL SERVER CONNECTION
    mail.smtp.auth=true
    mail.smtp.port=465
    mail.smtp.host=smtp.gmail.com


    The last three properties are required.
    Now you can use this follow example to send a simple email without attachments.
    That assumes that the mail configuration file is into the home folder of the project.

    Mailer mailer = new Mailer( new File( "mailer.properties" ) );
    Session s = mailer.login( "some.user@somemail.asd", "somePassword" );

    SimpleMessage message = new SimpleMessage( s );
    message.setSender( new Email( "some.user@somemail.asd" ) );
    message.setRecipient( new Email( "some.user@somemail.asd" ) );
    message.setSubject( "test mail" );
    message.setBodyMessage( "TEST", null );
    mailer.send( message );


    Author:
    Andrea Ghizzoni. More info at andrea.ghz@gmail.com

      • MailerManager

        public MailerManager(java.io.File configurationFile)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Instance a Mailer object that provides utilities to login into mail server and to send the email.
        the properties file MUST be like this:

        #IMPLEMENT THIS KEYS FOR DIFFERENT CONNECTION SETTINGS
        mail.smtp.starttls.enable=true
        mail.smtp.socketFactory.class=javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory
        #THE FOLLOW PROPERTIES ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL SERVER CONNECTION
        mail.smtp.auth=true
        mail.smtp.port=465
        mail.smtp.host=smtp.gmail.com

        Parameters:
        configurationFile - File the configuration file that describe the mail server connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception if the configuration file are not a properties file.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception if configuration file is null.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public javax.mail.Session login(java.lang.String user,
                       java.lang.String password)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException
        This method create a new session with the personal account of mail server.
        Parameters:
        user - String user name to login with mail server.
        password - String password to login with mail server.
        Returns:
        Session the session created with user name and password given.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - Exception if login fail.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception if user or password are null or empty string.

      • send

        public void send(SimpleMessage message)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 javax.mail.MessagingException
        This method sends the email at mail server configured.
        Parameters:
        message - SimpleMessage object represent the email to send.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception if SimpleMessage given is null.
        javax.mail.MessagingException - Exception if you are not logged in or sending fail.
